title: Why is Martin Fowler on the run in EastEnders – what has he done?
text:
Martin is back in Walford – but where did he go? (Picture: BBC)

We haven’t seen Martin Fowler (James Bye) in EastEnders for a while since he and wife Stacey (Lacey Turner) went on the run from Walford.

Until now that is, with Martin making a return to Albert Square in the wake of Bex (Jasmine Armfield)’s suicide attempt, only to get a roasting from Sonia (Natalie Cassidy) for not being there when his daughter needed him.

Of course Martin left Walford under very different circumstances – so just why have he and Stacey been away?

Here’s what you need to know…

Why is Martin Fowler on the run in EastEnders?

Martin Fowler has fled Albert Square with Stacey in tow in order to escape the clutches of Ben Mitchell (Max Bowden) – who knew that she was behind the attack which left his dad Phil (Steve McFadden) in a critical condition.

Martin’s there for Bex after her suicide attempt (Picture: BBC)

The storyline was written to accommodate Lacey Turner’s maternity leave from the show, with the actress having recently given birth to her first child, daughter Dusty Rose.

It’s not clear where they’ve been since they left although the Slater have been telling people they’re visiting Stacey’s brother Sean (Robert Kazinsky).

Martin’s return to the Square came on Friday as Sonia was seen desperately trying to get in touch with him, only for his phone to go to voicemail – leaving her berating him for not caring about his daughter.

Except, unbeknown to her, he was already back – and gave Sonia the shock of her life when she found him beside Bex’s hospital bed.

Expect the feud with Ben to continue in coming episodes as Martin agrees to stick around for Bex’s sake – except his nemesis spots him from across the Square.

All of which will spell trouble for him as he begs to allow Stacey to come back to Walford – only to end up being drafted into Ben’s dodgy dealings.

What will happen next? You’ll have to keep watching for that one.

EastEnders airs Mondays and Fridays on BBC One at 8pm and on Tuesdays and Thursdays at 7.30pm.
